countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under 5
mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births

definition: Neonatal (0-27 days) mortality rate (deaths per 1,000 live births)
indicator_cat: Met target (green/blue): country has achieved the SDG target of a NMR of at least as low as 12 per 1000 live births; On-track (yellow/light blue): country has not yet met the SDG target for NMR but according to its average annual rate of reduction (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it will achieve the NMR target by 2030; Acceleration needed (red/orange): country will not meet the SDG target for NMR based on its current average annual rate of reduction  (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it requires urgent accelerated action to meet the NMR target by 2030

countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under 5
mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births

definition: Neonatal (0-27 days) mortality rate (deaths per 1,000 live births)
indicator_cat: Met target (green/blue): country has achieved the SDG target of a NMR of at least as low as 12 per 1000 live births; On-track (yellow/light blue): country has not yet met the SDG target for NMR but according to its average annual rate of reduction (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it will achieve the NMR target by 2030; Acceleration needed (red/orange): country will not meet the SDG target for NMR based on its current average annual rate of reduction  (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it requires urgent accelerated action to meet the NMR target by 2030

indicator_cat: Met target (green/blue): country has achieved the SDG target of a U5MR of at least as low as 25 per 1000 live births; On-track (yellow/light blue): country has not yet met the SDG target for U5MR but according to its average annual rate of reduction (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it will achieve theU5MR target by 2030 if the ARR continues; Acceleration needed (red/orange): country will not meet the SDG target for U5MR based on its current average annual rate of reduction  (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it requires urgent accelerated action to meet the U5MR target by 2030

countries aiming to reduce neonatal mortality to at least as low as 12 per 1,000 live births and under 5
mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births

definition: Mortality rate for children age 1-4 years (deaths per 1000 children aged 1)
indicator_cat: Met target (green/blue): country has achieved the SDG target of a U5MR of at least as low as 25 per 1000 live births; On-track (yellow/light blue): country has not yet met the SDG target for U5MR but according to its average annual rate of reduction (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it will achieve theU5MR target by 2030 if the ARR continues; Acceleration needed (red/orange): country will not meet the SDG target for U5MR based on its current average annual rate of reduction  (determined for the 2020 estimates released in December 2021), it requires urgent accelerated action to meet the U5MR target by 2030

target: SDG Target 16.1: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere

source: Violence against women prevalence estimates, 2018: Global, regional, and national prevalence estimates for intimate partner violence against women and global and regional prevalence estimates for non-partner sexual violence against women. Geneva: World Health Organization; 2021. Available at: https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/ 9789240022256.
